benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search/{searchKey} - Search custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Happy path and many valid-parameter variations are tested (TC01, TC02, TC22).
Pagination: limit/offset behavior, paging boundaries, offset-beyond-records and combination with audit are covered (TC02, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC28).
Audit Controls: FULL, MINIMAL, NONE behaviors are explicitly tested (TC03, TC04, TC05).
Empty Response: Scenarios for no matches and out-of-range offsets return empty arrays (TC06, TC09).
Query Parameter Validation: Malformed and negative limit/offset and invalid audit values are tested; unsupported parameters are ignored (TC10, TC11, TC12, TC13, TC14).
Authorization: Missing and invalid authentication token scenarios are present (TC15, TC16) covering 401 responses.
Error Handling: Backend-unavailable (503) and unsupported HTTP method (405) are tested (TC17, TC30).
Security: XSS/injection attempt handling is included (TC18).
Performance & Concurrency: Stress and concurrent-request scenarios exist (TC19, TC20).
Edge Cases: Empty, whitespace-only, very long, and Unicode searchKey inputs are included (TC21, TC25, TC26, TC27).
Integration & Documentation: Data consistency with external services and API documentation/error message checks are included (TC23, TC24).
Defaults & Backwards Compatibility: Default query parameters and legacy-client behavior tested (TC29, TC22).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No explicit tests for throttling/429 behavior or retry headers (distinct from concurrency tests).
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GET (If-None-Match) or 304 behavior.

Schema and Content-Type Validation: Tests assert "JSON array of CustomField objects" but do not validate the response JSON schema fields/types against the CustomField definition nor verify Content-Type: application/json header.
Authorization depth: Only unauthenticated (401) cases are covered; no tests for authenticated-but-forbidden (403) or role-based access controls if applicable.
Server-side 5xx coverage: Apart from 503, there are no explicit tests for 500 Internal Server Error or behavior on unexpected server exceptions.
Path-parameter encoding / routing edge cases: No tests for reserved characters or embedded slashes in searchKey that could affect routing/encoding.

Enforced limits policy: The API default limit is documented (100) but tests do not verify server-enforced maximum limits or rejection of too-large limit values (TC07 uses 1000 without asserting server policy).
Missing-path-parameter behavior: No test for totally missing path parameter (invalid endpoint usage) to confirm 4xx/404 behavior per contract.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests that drive the endpoint to verify 429 Too Many Requests responses, Retry-After headers, and ensure rate-limiting is distinct from concurrency behavior.
Add caching tests: assert Cache-Control and ETag headers, test conditional GET (If-None-Match -> 304) and ensure correct Vary headers where applicable.
Introduce strict JSON schema validation against the CustomField definition (required fields, types, audit structure) and assert Content-Type: application/json in responses.
Add authorization/permission tests that cover 403 Forbidden scenarios (authenticated but unauthorized) and any role-based access rules the API may enforce.
Add simulated server-failure tests producing 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB exception simulation) to validate graceful error messages and monitoring hooks.
Add path-encoding tests for searchKey containing slashes, percent-encoded sequences, and other reserved characters to confirm correct routing and encoding handling.
Clarify and assert API limits: add tests that check server-enforced maximum limit behavior and proper error responses for requests exceeding allowed maxima.
Add a test for missing path parameter (invalid URL invocation) to assert whether the API returns 400/404 as per the contract.

If pagination metadata or link headers are part of the API, add tests to validate their presence and correctness; otherwise assert the behavior of defaults (offset=0, limit=100) explicitly when parameters are omitted.
Convert performance tests (TC19/TC20) into measurable CI checks with asserted SLOs (latency thresholds, error rates) so regressions are detected automatically.
